summary: This document is a TRUINTEL log from the Federal Bureau of Prisons, detailing routine operational entries for the 10 SOUTH UPPER housing unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York) from July 1-5, 2019. It records standard checks, counts, inmate movements, and PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) compliance rounds, showing the facility's operations in the weeks leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine security checks, inmate counts, and activities in the 10 South Upper housing unit on July 5-6, 2019. It details standard prison operations including rounds, equipment checks, and inmate movements, but does not contain specific information about Jeffrey Epstein. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM) from July 6-9, 2019, detailing routine security checks, counts, and activities in the 10 South Upper housing unit. It shows standard prison operations in the days leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations from July 9-12, 2019. It details standard cell checks, counts, and inmate activities, including specific entries for inmates Joshua Schulte and Joaquin Guzman. The log was generated on August 19, 2019, and shows the normal administrative procedures in the housing unit where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations from July 12-15, 2019. It details standard cell checks, counts, and inmate activities, including entries for inmate Joshua Schulte and a legal visit for inmate Joaquin Guzman. The log shows normal, secured operations in the 10 South Upper housing unit. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations from July 16-18, 2019. It details standard cell checks, counts, and inmate movements in the 10 South Upper housing unit, which housed inmates including Joaquin Guzman and Joshua Schulte. The logs show no unusual activity reported for these dates. This document contains Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log entries for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, detailing routine security checks, counts, and activities in the 10 South Upper housing unit from July 18-21, 2019. The logs show standard prison operations and note the presence of specific inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, during the period shortly before his death. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log detailing routine security and operational activities for Housing Unit 10 South Upper at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York from July 21-24, 2019. It records standard checks, counts, and rounds, with specific notations about PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) compliance and the unit officer's lack of TRUSCOPE access. This document is a series of Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log entries from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, detailing routine prison operations and checks in the 10 South Upper housing unit over several days in July 2019. The logs show standard activities like rounds, counts, and medication administration, including to inmate Joshua Schulte. This document contains Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log entries from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 28, 2019, to August 2, 2019. It details routine security checks, counts, and activities in the 10 South Upper housing unit, including specific entries related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Cell 303) and other inmates. The logs show standard prison operations in the days leading up to Epstein's death. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations from August 2-6, 2019. It details standard security checks, counts, and inmate activities in the 10 South Upper housing unit, including a specific entry regarding inmate Joshua Schulte receiving medication. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine housing unit activities and checks from August 6-9, 2019. It details standard prison operations, including counts, rounds, and inmate activities, with specific mentions of inmate Joshua Schulte and a refusal of a legal visit by inmate Saipov. The log was entered on August 19, 2019. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations and inmate checks in the 10 South Upper housing unit from August 9 to August 13, 2019. It details standard security rounds, counts, and medical activities for inmates, including Joshua Schulte and Mirsad Kandic, but contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein or his case. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations from August 13-15, 2019. It details standard cell checks, counts, and inmate activities for Housing Unit 10 South Upper, including a specific entry regarding inmate Joshua Schulte receiving medication. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine prison operations on August 15-16, 2019. It details standard cell checks, counts, inmate movements, and activities for Housing Unit 10 South Upper, which housed five inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein. The log shows normal operations in the hours leading up to Epstein's death. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, detailing routine security checks, counts, and activities in the 10 South Upper housing unit on August 16-17, 2019. It records the presence of inmates, including Mirsad Kandic and Joshua Schulte, and standard prison operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death. This document is a Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering routine security and operational checks in the 10 South Upper housing unit from August 17-19, 2019. It details standard prison procedures, including counts, rounds, and equipment checks, and notes the presence of inmate Joshua Schulte. The log was generated on August 19, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.
